messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Broadway was: is it enough?
messages.msgSnippet: ... We live fifteen minutes from Disneyland - lots and lots of Roxana s theater friends work there and I imagine she ll be wanting to work there, soon. They
messages.messageBody:
On Jun 8, 2006, at 11:53 AM, Michelle/Melbrigða wrote:

>> So - we support that interest, entirely and wholeheartedly.
>
> Disney has a wonderful college program and intern program for
> preforming arts. They get a chance to get some "professional
> time"under their wings and beef up their resume. There used to be a
> young girl at my church who was so gung-ho on being a Broadway
> actress. She went to college and found out about this program. Every
> summer she would go there and work and she did a 2 year internship
> there after she graduated from college. She loved it! I wish I knew
> what she was doing now because she was one of those really neat kids
> that was truly living her passion. I don't know if she ever made it
> to Broadway, but I do know that she had many wonderful adventures
> getting there!

We live fifteen minutes from Disneyland - lots and lots of Roxana's
theater friends work there and I imagine she'll be wanting to work
there, soon. They are characters (Stitch, Prince Charming), they
dance down the street in the parades, they're in the Aladdin show,
etc. I'll have to look into any actual internship programs.

-pam

Unschooling shirts, cups, bumper stickers, bags...
Live Love Learn
UNSCHOOL!
<http://www.cafepress.com/livelovelearn>

messages.subject: Broadway was: is it enough?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Disney has a wonderful college program and intern program for preforming arts.  They get a chance to get some professional time under their wings and beef
messages.messageBody:
On 6/8/06, Pamela Sorooshian <pamsoroosh@...> wrote:
>
> On Jun 8, 2006, at 8:29 AM, Beth Mouser wrote:
>
> > I agree we need to support his goals
> > and abilities, but this is difficult when he wants to become a pro
> > player.
>
>
> I know the feeling. My kid wants to be a Broadway musical theater
> star. I have the same concerns about that bursting bubble, that you
> do, even though my kid is talented and hard-working and has a
> (remote) chance.
>
> So - we support that interest, entirely and wholeheartedly.

Disney has a wonderful college program and intern program for
preforming arts. They get a chance to get some "professional
time"under their wings and beef up their resume. There used to be a
young girl at my church who was so gung-ho on being a Broadway
actress. She went to college and found out about this program. Every
summer she would go there and work and she did a 2 year internship
there after she graduated from college. She loved it! I wish I knew
what she was doing now because she was one of those really neat kids
that was truly living her passion. I don't know if she ever made it
to Broadway, but I do know that she had many wonderful adventures
getting there!


--
Michelle
aka Melbrigða
http://eventualknitting.blogspot.com
MedHS@yahoogroups.com - Homeschooling for the Medieval Recreationist
